alert.note: Alert for Adams; Cumberland; Dauphin; Perry; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:51PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN ADAMS...NORTHWESTERN YORK...SOUTHWESTERN DAUPHIN...EASTERN CUMBERLAND AND EAST CENTRAL PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Enola to Carlisle to 12 miles southwest of Mechanicsburg. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Harrisburg, Carlisle, Lower Allen, Progress, Mechanicsburg, Camp Hill, New Cumberland, Enola, Steelton, Lemoyne, Schlusser, Boiling Springs, Wormleysburg, Penbrook, Dillsburg, Lake Meade, Marysville, Mount Holly Springs, Shiremanstown and Paxtang. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
